p: The wettability of the product was systematically analyzed for investigating its hydrophobic performance. A water droplet with a volume of 5 μL on the product surface (it was difficult to do this due to the rather small rolling angle, <1°, as shown in Table 1) was close to a sphere in the typical Cassie state [ 28, 30, 31], as seen in the photo embedded in Figure 3b. The corresponding water contact angle was measured at ca. 170°, which meant that the SAFFs were outstandingly superhydrophobic [ 32, 33, 34, 35]. It is worth mentioning that the samples from the different parallel experiments showed similar results, as seen in Table 1.
